intro: Oerstedella parviexasperata, commonly known as the small-bristled oxalis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Oxalidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its unique bristly texture on the leaves and stems distinguishes it from other oxalis species. Oerstedella parviexasperata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
